title: Arsenal news: Matteo Guendouzi admits he had no choice but to haul down Wilfried Zaha
text:
Matteo Guendouzi refused to apologise for his rugby-style challenge on Wilfried Zaha in the final moments of Arsenal's draw with Crystal Palace, stating he simply had to do it.

The Palace midfielder was threatening to launch a counter-attack in the final seconds of the game, and Guendouzi, the last line of the Gunners' defence, took matters into his own hands by wrestling the Ivory Coast international to the ground.

Asked about his over-the-top challenge, the 20-year-old said: 'I had to foul Zaha at the end, otherwise he is through on goal on his own,' Guendouzi told Arsenal.com.

Matteo Guendouzi insists he had no choice but to haul down Wilfried Zaha at The Emirates

Guendouzi spotted the danger as Zaha looked to go past him as Palace broke on the counter

The Frenchman went in on Zaha rugby-style to make sure the winger's progress was halted

Guendouzi spoke to his opponent at the end of the game following the incident

'I'm the last defender but I'm far from our goal as well. I had to do it.

'We really wanted to win the game, so we attacked a lot towards the end to get the third goal. We allowed spaces [for Palace on the break] but it's because we really wanted to win.'

Guendouzi's actions helped Arsenal preserve a 2-2 draw at the Emirates Stadium, but it could, and possibly should, have been a whole lot better.

Arsenal were two goals to the good inside 10 minutes, but were pegged back by Roy Hodgson's side thanks to a Luka Milivokevic penalty and Jordan Ayew.

Sokratis scored Arsenal's opener and later had what he thought was the winner ruled out by VAR. David Luiz was also on target.
